CardDescriptions.1: A mighty oak tree that forms the foundation of terrestrial ecosystems through photosynthesis.
CardDescriptions.2: Giant kelp creates underwater forests that support diverse marine life.
CardDescriptions.3: Reed canary grass thrives in wetland environments, bridging aquatic and terrestrial domains.
CardDescriptions.4: European rabbits are prolific herbivores that form the base of many food webs.
CardDescriptions.5: Sockeye salmon are anadromous fish that connect marine and freshwater ecosystems.
CardDescriptions.6: American black bears are omnivorous mammals that play key roles in forest ecosystems.
CardDescriptions.7: Great white sharks are apex predators that maintain balance in marine food webs.
CardDescriptions.8: Mycena mushrooms decompose organic matter, recycling nutrients back to the ecosystem.
CardDescriptions.9: Turkey vultures are scavengers that clean up carrion and prevent disease spread.
CardDescriptions.10: Deer ticks are parasites that feed on host blood while potentially transmitting diseases.
CardDescriptions.11: Common earthworms process detritus and improve soil structure through their feeding.
CardDescriptions.12: Dung beetles recycle organic waste, playing a crucial role in nutrient cycling.
CardDescriptions.13: Soil bacteria decompose organic matter and cycle nutrients in terrestrial ecosystems.
CardDescriptions.14: Decomposer mushrooms break down dead organic matter, returning nutrients to the soil.
CardDescriptions.15: Deep sea bacteria use chemosynthesis to create energy from hydrothermal vent chemicals.
CardDescriptions.16: Iron spring bacteria oxidize iron compounds to generate energy in freshwater environments.
CardDescriptions.17: Mycorrhizal fungi form beneficial partnerships with plant roots, enhancing nutrient uptake.
CardDescriptions.18: Nitrogen-fixing bacteria convert atmospheric nitrogen into forms plants can use.
CardDescriptions.19: Pacific krill are small crustaceans that form the base of many marine food chains.
CardDescriptions.20: Phytoplankton are microscopic marine plants that produce much of Earth's oxygen.
CardDescriptions.21: Zooplankton are tiny animals that feed on phytoplankton and support marine food webs.
CardDescriptions.22: European honey bees are important pollinators that support plant reproduction.
CardDescriptions.25: Volcanic bacteria thrive in extreme heat, using hydrogen for chemosynthesis.
CardDescriptions.26: Nitrifying bacteria convert ammonia to nitrates, essential for the nitrogen cycle.
CardDescriptions.27: Sediment bacteria use chemosynthesis in marine sediments to process organic matter.

CardAbilitiesText.1: [WATERSHED PREDATOR] (Action): Exhaust this card. Target one [AQUATIC] creature adjacent to an [AMPHIBIOUS] card that this Bear is also adjacent to. Exhaust that target.
CardAbilitiesText.2: [APEX PREDATOR] (Action): Exhaust this card. Target an adjacent +3C or +4C creature. It becomes Exhausted.
CardAbilitiesText.3: [SCAVENGE] (Action): Exhaust this card. Take one creature card from the Detritus Zone and put it into your hand.
CardAbilitiesText.4: [PARASITIC DRAIN] (Persistent): The host creature does not Ready during its owner's Ready Phase.
CardAbilitiesText.5: [RECYCLER] (Action): Exhaust this card. Place the card underneath the adjacent -1S card into your score pile. It is worth its printed VP +1. Then, draw a card.
CardAbilitiesText.6: [PHOTOSYNTHESIS] (Persistent): During your Ready Phase, if this card is adjacent to fewer than 3 other cards, ready this card even if it was exhausted.
CardAbilitiesText.7: [PACK HUNTER] (Action): Exhaust this card and one adjacent creature you control. Target an adjacent creature with trophic level equal to or less than the combined trophic levels of the exhausted cards. Exhaust that target.
CardAbilitiesText.8: [FILTER FEEDER] (Action): Exhaust this card. If this card is adjacent to a [MARINE] producer, draw a card.
CardAbilitiesText.9: [METAMORPHOSIS] (Action): Exhaust this card. You may play its adult form from your hand without paying its cost, placing it in this card's position. Put this card in your score pile.
CardAbilitiesText.10: [DECOMPOSER] (Persistent): When a creature card is placed in the Detritus Zone adjacent to this card, gain 1 VP.
CardAbilitiesText.11: [VENOMOUS] (Action): Exhaust this card. Target an adjacent creature. Apply poison status to that target.
CardAbilitiesText.12: [FRUGIVORE] (Persistent): When this card is adjacent to a fruit-producing plant, gain bonus effects during your Ready Phase.
CardAbilitiesText.13: [INSECTIVORE] (Persistent): When this card is adjacent to arthropod creatures, gain bonus effects during your Ready Phase.
CardAbilitiesText.14: [HYPERCARNIVORE] (Persistent): Gain bonus VP when this card is in a cluster of 3+ carnivore creatures.
CardAbilitiesText.15: [MIGRATORY] (Start of Turn): You may move this card up to 2 spaces to an adjacent valid position.
CardAbilitiesText.16: [CHEMICAL OPPORTUNIST] (Action): You may instead connect this card to an adjacent -1S card you control. If you do, draw a card.
CardAbilitiesText.17: [DETRITAL PROCESSOR] (Action): You may instead connect this card to an adjacent -2D card you control. If you do, that -2D gains +1 VP when scored.
